description.value:
A Condition profile describing child disorders as defined by BabyConnect. Child disorders, such as chromosomal and congenital abnormalities or other problems are disorders of the child. The subject is either the child Patient (in case the child is born or a fetal patient record is in place) or the woman Patient (in case the child is unborn and there is no fetal patient record in place). In the second case, use the bodySite reference extension to refer to the fetus. * Child disorders can refer to the EpisodeOfCare with Condition.context.reference * A ConceptMap is available to map verification status to accepted FHIR codes
Pattern: [[Child disorder | https://informatiestandaarden.nictiz.nl/wiki/Gebz:FHIR_IG_bc-DisorderOfChild]]

comment.value: ConcernForTransfer is renamed to Problem with release 2017 of the HCIMs.

definition.value: The subject of the condition is either the child patient or the (unborn) fetus patient in case a fetus record exists for the fetus. In case there is no fetal record (and hence no fetus patient) the fetus extension SHALL be used instead.
